tool.name: ConvertCoordinates

param.name: Input_Table
param.pythonReference: There is no python reference for this parameter.

param.name: Input_Coordinate_Format
param.expression: DD_2 | DD_1 | DDM_1 | DDM_2 | DMS_1 | DMS_2 | GARS | GEOREF | UTM_BANDS | UTM_ZONES | USNG | MGRS
param.dialogReference:
Format of the input table coordinates. The default is DD_2.

  • DD_1 — Longitude and latitude coordinates are in a single field with coordinates separated by a space, a comma, or a slash.

  • DD_2 — Longitude and latitude coordinates are in two separate fields.

  • DDM_1 — Longitude and latitude coordinates are in a single field with coordinates separated by a space, a comma, or a slash.

  • DDM_2 — Longitude and latitude coordinates are in two separate fields.

  • DMS_1 — Longitude and latitude coordinates are in a single field with coordinates separated by a space, a comma, or a slash.

  • DMS_2 — Longitude and latitude coordinates are in two separate fields.

  • GARS — Global Area Reference System.

  • GEOREF — World Geographic Reference System.

  • UTM_ZONES — Universal Transverse Mercator coordinate zones.

  • UTM_BANDS — Universal Transverse Mercator coordinate bands.

  • USNG — United States National Grid.

  • MGRS — Military Grid Reference System.
param.pythonReference: There is no python reference for this parameter.

param.name: X_Field__longitude__UTM__MGRS__USNG__GARS__GEOREF_
param.displayname: X Field (longitude, UTM, MGRS, USNG, GARS, GEOREF)
param.dialogReference: Input table field containing the longitude coordinates.
param.pythonReference: There is no python reference for this parameter.

param.name: Y_Field__latitude_
param.dialogReference:
Input table field containing the latitude coordinates.

This field is not used for DD_1, DDM_1, DMS_1, UTM_BANDS, UTM_ZONES, MGRS, USNG, GARS, and GEOREF.
param.pythonReference: There is no python reference for this parameter.

param.name: Output_Table
param.pythonReference: There is no python reference for this parameter.

param.name: Spatial_Reference
param.dialogReference: Output table spatial reference. The default is GCS_WGS_1984.
param.pythonReference: There is no python reference for this parameter.

tool.summary: Converts source coordinates in a table to multiple coordinate formats. This tool uses an input table with coordinates and outputs a new table with fields for the following coordinate formats: Decimal Degrees, Decimal Degrees Minutes, Degrees Minutes Seconds, Universal Transverse Mercator, Military Grid Reference System, U.S. National Grid, Global Area Reference System, and World Geographic Reference System.
tool.usage: The output table maintains the original fields of the input table and adds text fields for the converted notations including: DDLat, DDLon, DDMLat, DDMLon, DMS, UTM, MGRS, USNG, GARS, GEOREF.

scriptExample.title: There are no code samples for this tool.

This tool uses an input table with coordinates and outputs a new table with fields for the following coordinate formats: Decimal Degrees, Decimal Degrees Minutes, Degrees Minutes Seconds, Universal Transverse Mercator, Military Grid Reference System, U.S. National Grid, Global Area Reference System, and World Geographic Reference System.
